_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
1/31 6AM - Good morning, Stratton! For your Saturday, we have 99 open trails, of which 73 trails were freshly striped up overnight by our hardworking grooming team. 14 lifts are set to spin at 8:30 AM, with possible weather and wind delays. The snow has been great, but to enjoy it to the fullest, layer up, cover your face, stay hydrated, and take frequent breaks in the lodge. Stay warm, everyone, and have fun!

With conditions lining up this well, its a good time to take advantage of a few extra perks. Were offering 50% off lift tickets every Wednesday and Thursday this seasonexcluding Presidents Week. Pass holders can spread the love too, sharing 50% off a regular-price lift ticket purchased before February 13, usable any day this season. And to celebrate our snowboarding roots, were offering $49 adult snowboard lessons through January 31. With stellar conditions and 7:45AM lift access for everyone on Friday, theres never been a better time to get after it!

Safety Tip: Wear an extra layer and keep your face covered.

The Ikon Stoke Event is back in action this Saturday and Sunday! Saturday rolls into a pass holder party at Grizzlys with music, raffles, and Ikon swag. The weekend wraps up Sunday with complimentary First Tracks at 7:45AM, exclusively for Ikon Pass holders. Dont forget to enter for your chance to win a 26/27 Ikon Pass and keep the stoke rolling into next season!

Reliable cars are the name of the game; that is why we trust Oliver Subaru and Ford. Made for all seasons and all families, check out Oliver Ford and Oliver Subaru for year-round reliability!

Stay and relish the Green Mountains! Stratton Real Estate is here to help with all your real estate needs. Make your sweet escape a reality.

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Saturday, January 30, 6:33am -   Partly sunny today with a high near 53 degrees. Light southwest winds around 5 mph will become calm as the day goes on. Enjoy the warmer temperatures and follow the sun to find softer snow. Check the daily grooming report for the best corduroy early in the day. Ski with caution and be aware of obstacles that may be hidden beneath the snow. 

  • Parking reservations are every weekend and holiday. Learn more about our Parking Program and Carpool Incentives.
  • For real time information at your fingertips, download the Ikon Pass App for updates on lift status, events, weather, and more.
_inspectorSnowReport.Alert:
Fast and firm conditions. Ensure your gear is properly tuned.
In an emergency, please contact: Palisades Dispatch 1 (530) 452-7145 | Alpine Dispatch 1 (530) 581-8222

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Sunny, with a high near 39. West wind 3 to 8 mph. 
Test the latest CARV Ski Technology at Deer Valley. Stop by Silver Lake Beach and experience real-time, on-mountain coaching with AI-powdered analysis that tracks every run and shows you how to improve. Simply clip the sensors to your boots, ski as usual, and get instant audio tips to elevate your technique.

Stop by Silver Lake Beach and experience real-time, on-mountain coaching with AI-powdered analysis that tracks every run and shows you how to improve. Simply clip the sensors to your boots, ski as usual, and get instant audio tips to elevate your technique.

_inspectorSnowReport.Report: Saturday, January 31, 5:15 a.m. The weekend has arrived time to ski and ride! Today should be another great cruising day, with mostly sunny skies and temperatures in the upper 30s. Our groomers have been up all night laying down fresh corduroy on 20+ of our 70 open trails. Jibbers rejoice the Soli Parks Tow makes its debut in the Main Street Terrain Park today! Join us at 10:00 a.m. for a live DJ and the official opening. The 2026 Solitude IFSA Qualifier big mountain competition continues today in Wanderer Bowl. Watch local youth drop and bump their way down Paradise Lost and Vertigo. Registration is full but spectating is free catch the thrills from the bottom of Abbas Alley. Conditions are firm over much of the mountain right now. Keep an eye out for icy spots and please check your speed. Respect our slow zones as well as other skiers and riders. Have a super Saturday at Solitude!

Join us at 10:00 a.m. for a live DJ and the official opening. The 2026 Solitude IFSA Qualifier big mountain competition continues today in Wanderer Bowl. Watch local youth drop and bump their way down Paradise Lost and Vertigo. Registration is full but spectating is free  catch the thrills from the bottom of Abbas Alley. Conditions are firm over much of the mountain right now. Keep an eye out for icy spots and please check your speed. Respect our slow zones as well as other skiers and riders. Have a super Saturday at Solitude!

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Saturday, January 31st 2026 - Good Morning Skiers and Riders! This is Laurie with your snow report from 5am for Saturday, January 31st. Remember the easiest way to get up to date information is on the Ikon Pass app or website.  

 At Mid Mountain, weve had 1 new inch of snow in the past 24 hours, with 0 inches falling since the mountain closed yesterday.  

At the Summit, weve had 1.5 new inches of snow in the past 24 hours, with 0 inches falling since the mountain closed yesterday.  

Our Mid mountain base is 30 inches, the temperature is 25 degrees, the winds are 9 miles per hour from the W, with cloudy skies. 

The Summit base is 46 inches, the temperature is 16 degrees, the winds are 20 miles per hour from the WNW, with cloudy_skies. 

The base temperature is 30 degrees.  

We will be skiing and riding on 19 lifts, 161 runs, and 2801 acres on PP snow.  

Join us in Steamboat Square tonight, January 31 at 5:30 for the Ski Town U.S.A. Celebration, honoring the Ski Town athletes and legends who helped shape our mountains legacy. From heartfelt recognition to community pride, this is a chance to celebrate the people who put Steamboat on the world stage. Get all the event details at steamboat.com/events. 

Stay in the know with the Ikon Pass App. Find it in the app store on your mobile device and get lift and trail statuses, conditions updates, and more.  

If you are thinking of exploring outside the ski area boundaries, and dont know exactly where you are going, dont go.  

Ski and Ride with Care and we will see you on the mountain!

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Saturday, January 31, 2026 6:30 AM Partly cloudy skies today, with light winds and temps into the 40s. Beginning at 7:30 AM, MMCF's First Tracks will allow early access to Broadway Express (1), Stump Alley Express (2), and Face Lift Express (3) to ticket holders. 24 lifts are scheduled to spin at 8:30 AM, conditions permitting. Saddle Bowl is your go-to this morning if youre chasing that fresh-cord feeling. 
 
Conditions and Visibility: Partly cloudy skies, light winds, and temps into the 40s today. Groomers start crisp and carve-ready this morning, then soften up in the sun this afternoon. 
Lift status: 24 lifts are on the schedule to operate today, conditions permitting.  
Today's Events: MMCF First Tracks from 7:30-8:30AM at Broadway Express (1), Stump Alley Express (2), and Face Lift Express (3). 
Sierra STEM & Patty Shack Ice Cream Social from 1-6PM at The Patty Shack.  
The Clay Colton Band from 12-3PM at Tusks Bar at Main Lodge. 
DJ Ape Screen from 12-3PM at Woolly's Adventure Summit. 
Gabe Dagrazio from 1-4PM at Eagle Lodge. 
Weekend Aprs Party with DJ WLDCT from 2:30-5PM at Canyon Lodge. 
Woolly's Dance Party from 3:45-4:30PM at the Village.  
Full Moon Snowshoe Tour Presented by Smartwool from 6:30-8:15PM. 
Safety: Don't hit and run. If you are involved in a collision or incident, share your contact information with each other and an employee. Visit our Safety page for more tips. Our on-mountain emergency hotline is: 760.934.0611
Road Conditions: Roads are mostly clear, but slick spots may exist in the shade. Drive with caution. Check our Road Conditions page for the latest status.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport: Don't hit and run. If you are involved in a collision or incident, share your contact information with each other and an employee. Emergency Hotline: 760.934.0611

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Saturday, January 31, 2026 -- 7:45AM
 Closing out January with another awesome Bucky's Bonfire! Temps in the 40s with light winds and partly cloudy skies. Long lunch in the Chalet? Check out the falafel at Hot To Go just right outside the Chalet!

1/31/26 9:20 AM Update: Chair 6 and Southback are open!
Good morning, Crystal Mountain! With this week's snow refresh, groomers are skiing better than ever. It's going to be a great day of Cascade cruisin'! Off-piste snow surfaces still remain variable but may soften up nicely in the afternoon. Continue to expect with limited coverage and unmarked hazards. Please ski and ride with caution! We have mixed precip across the mountain this morning, but the forecast for calls for partly sunny skies towards the afternoon. Night skiing continues 'till 8pm tonight on Disco and Quicksilver, with Rafters and Bootpack/Foodhall open late. Grab your skis, enjoy the fresh mountain air, and keep your legs ready for when Mother Nature provides again! 

Terrain Parks: Disco and Lower Arwine's parks are open.

Events: Today! Join us for our Summit Apres: Hot Ones. Brace yourself for the fiery thrill of the Hot Ones Wing Eating Competition, where heat levels rise to gut-wrenching extremes, and prizes are on the line! Summit House's last regular seating will be at 2pm today.

Notes for today:
  1. Starting next Thursday, 2/5, Night Skiing Hours will be adjusted to 4pm to 7pm. Night Skiing has been cancelled for the following dates: 2/16, 2/17, and 2/18.
  2. Weve made the decision to discontinue the parking waitlist for the 25/26 season. Parking reservations are back to first-come, first-served basis, and still required on weekends and holidays
  3. Book your shuttle today! The Crystal Express Shuttle is free with a reservation, and runs on weekends and holidays, with multiple departures from the Enumclaw Expo Center Parking Lot. 
  4. $62 Day tickets continues every Tuesday for the remainder of the season!
  5. Did you know it just takes 5 Days to be entered to win a 26/27 Ikon Pass? Track your days on the Ikon App and register for RIDE TO WIN
  6. Looking to save time and make the most of the day? Consider grabbing a Daily Reserve Upgrade! Offered on weekends and holidays, this upgrade grants access to priority lift lines, getting you on the lift quicker and more laps faster. 
  7. Parking Reservation cancellations are always required if you're not planning on making it up. No-show policy applies. Do your part to ensure everyone has access to the mountain. Thank you! Paid reservations can only be cancelled by emailing SP+ at  CrystalMtnParking@spplus.com with Reservation #, First Name, and Last Name. While you may not receive an immediate reply, the cancellation will be processed. The Crystal Mountain Contact center cannot process these cancellations.
  8. In case of on-mountain emergency: Call 360-663-3064 or 911

Mountain Weather 1/30/2026 4:30pm 

Forecaster: Bradford Swanson

Synopsis: After what was a surprisingly over productive system moving through today (Friday), it seems like our active weather is going to linger for a couple more days. Precipitation is certainly losing steam, but there is a chance of occasional sprinkles over the next few days as temperatures remain relatively warm. Crystal mountains fever will continue to rise through the evening, hopefully breaking sometime tomorrow. Generally unsettled weather is the theme of this weekend. That being said, the snow surface is responding quite well to the latest round of storms and skiing has improved drastically!

Friday Night:  
Sky Cover: Cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 8,000
12hr Precip: Light rain
Wind Trends: Light West.
Saturday: 
Sky Cover: Partly cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 8,000
12hr Precip: Occasional light rain
Wind Trends: Light Southwest, Moderate afternoon gusts
Saturday Night:  
Sky Cover: Mostly cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 7,500
12hr Precip: Trace amounts of snow possible
Wind Trends: Strong to extreme Southwest. 60mph gusts

Outlook: Sunday and Monday are looking quite promising, with temperatures looking to take a drastic dip. Additionally, there is some light snow coming in as well, a lovely little 2-4 refresh. Keep your spirits high, the long range forecast models are painting a very optimistic picture. 

Uphill Travel Update: See the above banner for the current status. Please visit guest services to get your 25/26 uphill travel card, this must be renewed free of charge for the season. Uphill travel may be prohibited at any time as mountain operations teams conduct avalanche mitigation. Refer to the "No Uphill Travel" lights around the base area and the Mountain Report page indicating the status of the designated route. These lights are located by the Gondola trail map, bottom of Chinook, bottom of Discovery, and top of Quicksilver lift shack. For more information about uphill travel, please visit the uphill travel page. 

25/26 WINTER PROGRAMS,CLINICS, AND NECESSITIES

  • Ski and Ride School: Explore our programs and find your right fit.
  • Freeride Program (NEW! Adult Programs now available): Registration now open, limited spots available! 
  • AIARE Course & Certification: Ski the backcountry with expert knowledge and certification
  • Seasonal Gear storage: Hassle-free on mountain storage with limited availability, lock your space in today!
  • Seasonal Lockers: For you or the entire family, check out options today .
  • Full Day Seasonal Lesson Programs for 4-6 year olds are now available- with lunch included too!  Secure your spot. Already signed up for a 2-hour session and want to upgrade? No problemjust call us at 833-279-7895

_inspectorSnowReport.Alert:
Chair 6 is and Southback are open. Gold Hills and Northway will remain closed due to snow conditions. 

Uphill Travel Status: PERMITTED. Uphill Travel is only permitted up the standard route up the Meadow and Quicksilver. Status is subject to closure at any time, and travelers must check Uphill Status lights before departure.

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
January 31st, 1:24 PM
Good afternoon skiers and riders. Winter is showing off today with a crisp Arctic chill, but the turns are pure. Cold temps are keeping the snow fast, firm, and absolutely beautiful. Bundle up and get ready for some midwinter magic! Tomorrows forecast brings partly sunny skies in the morning with clouds increasing throughout the day. Expect mid-to-low single digits up top and mid-to-low teens at the base. Snowmaking continues on Sunrise and Birch Run for a little refill action. North Lynx terrain is recommended for advanced skiers and riders only. Well be getting down on 475 skiable acres, with 49 of 110 trails groomed, including favorites like Ripcord, Waterfall, and Cruiser. Look forward to beautiful firm groomers along with firm packed powder conditions across the mountain.

Operations are back to regular weekend hours. GMX, Super Bravo, and Heaven's Gate will load at 8:00 AM. All other scheduled lifts open at 9:00 AM. Slide Brook will be running tomorrow at 10:00 AM, but may experience holds due to cold temperatures. An update on GMX: We appreciate everyones patience as our team has been addressing a tower alignment over the last couple of days. Work has been slowed due to the excessive cold temps and high winds as we work to keep our crews safe. We do expect GMX to spin for the weekend and anticipate some work next week as we finish up some fine tuning.

Sugarbush still has plenty of freestyle fun on tap. At Mt. Ellen, youll find over 90 features on Riemergasse and another 27 on Sugar Run, all serviced by the iconic Sunny Quad. At Lincoln Peak, Slowpoke now has 12 refreshed features with a couple more coming, and 5 playful features remain over in Sugarbear Forest. Brambles and Inverness will be reserved for racing tomorrow. Racers' Edge will be closed to the public for racing. Folks interested in racing, can pay for the NASTAR course at the top shack on the course.
 
It's the last day to play Blizzard Bingo as part of NSAA Safety Month! Ski, ride, and learn across Sugarbush throughout January. Swing by the Creation Station, across from Guest Services at both Lincoln Peak and Mt. Ellen, to design your own safetythemed poster. Todays tip: Help a Friend. Fun for all ages, and a great way to celebrate Safety Month while checking out our winter events.

All uphill travel routes are open at both Lincoln Peak and Mt. Ellen. Please review our Uphill Travel Policy for full details.

Saturday January 31st 2026 | 6:49

Bonjour Tremblant!

Its a crisp start to Saturday on the mountain, but sunshine is on the way to help warm things up and set the stage for a great ski day. Dress for the cold early, then enjoy improving comfort as the sun takes over. Due to the chilly morning temperatures, some areas will be opening gradually today. Please review the operational updates below.

Lift & Terrain Updates
  • The Duncan Lift, Soleil Lift, and Soleil slope will open gradually this morning as conditions allow.
  • On the North Side, First Tracks will be available via the Expo and Lowell Thomas lifts.
  • Casino Express will be in operation starting at 7:30 a.m.
Terrain Parks & Glades
  • Terrain Parks: All parks are in great shape, offering a variety of features for all ability levels.
  • Glade Skiing: Glade conditions remain excellent, with solid coverage delivering playful turns and some of the best skiing of the season.
With sunshine, great conditions, and plenty of terrain to enjoy, its shaping up to be another beautiful day on the mountain. Stay warm early and make the most of every turn!

Mountain safety tip of the week:  Always stay in control to ensure you can stop and avoid others or obstacles.
 
Snow fall is recorded daily at 5 a.m from mid-mountain at North Side (550 m / 1,800 ft). This data, based on 24 hours, provides a picture of on-mountain conditions. Actual accumulation may differ from the official report. Be aware of changing conditions. Lifts and trails exist in a mountain environment and may close due to weather, usage and/or special maintenance.
_inspectorSnowReport.Alert:
SATURDAY 31st OF JANUARY 2026

Here is some information about the operations on Saturday, January 31, 2026.
-Duncan lift, Soleil lift, and Soleil slope opening gradually
-On the North side, the first tracks by Expo and Lowell Thomas.
-Casino Express in operation at 7:45
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport: Happy Saturday! It will be a cold start to the day on the mountain, with sunshine expected to warm things up through the morning. Due to chilly temperatures, some areas will open gradually today. The Duncan Lift, Soleil Lift, and Soleil slope will open as conditions allow. On the North Side, First Tracks will be available via the Expo and Lowell Thomas lifts. Casino Express will operate starting at 7:30 a.m. Terrain parks and glades remain in great condition!
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReportFrench: Bon samedi! La journe dbute sous un froid marqu en montagne, avec du soleil attendu pour rchauffer les conditions au fil de la matine. En raison des tempratures froides, certaines zones ouvriront progressivement aujourdhui. Les remontes Duncan, Soleil et la piste Soleil ouvriront selon les conditions. Du ct Nord, First Tracks sera offert via Expo et Lowell Thomas. Casino Express sera en opration ds 7 h 30.

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Updated: Jan 30, 2026

We're getting close to that magic one-metre base depth, which means it's time to shift gears! Renovators are coming out to turn the snowpack over and break up some snowpack later this weekend. 

Also: Yahoo park is getting built out, fresh moguls just dropped on Rinus Run, and Big Dipper is locked and loaded for spring. Get the full scoop in our Operations Update on the blog.
